sinaiticus.text: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

verses.text: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

sinaiticus.text: Abraham begot Isaac: Isaac begot Jacob: Jacob begot Judah and his brothers:

verses.text: Abraham begot Isaac: Isaac begot Jacob: Jacob begot Judah and his brothers:

sinaiticus.text: Judah begot Pharez and Zerah of Tamar: Pharez begot Hezron: Hezron begot Ram:

verses.text: Judah begot Pharez and Zerah of Tamar: Pharez begot Hezron: Hezron begot Ram:

sinaiticus.text: Ram begot Amminadab: Amminadab begot Nashon: Nashon begot Salmon:

verses.text: Ram begot Amminadab: Amminadab begot Nashon: Nashon begot Salmon:

sinaiticus.text: Salmon begot Boaz of Rahab: Boaz begot Obed of Ruth: Obed begot Jesse:

verses.text: Salmon begot Boaz of Rahab: Boaz begot Obed of Ruth: Obed begot Jesse:

sinaiticus.text: Jesse begot David the king. David begot Solomon of the wife of Uriah:

verses.text: Jesse begot David the king. David begot Solomon of the wife of Uriah:

sinaiticus.text: Solomon begot Rehoboam: Rehoboam begot Abijah: Abijah begot Asa:

verses.text: Solomon begot Rehoboam: Rehoboam begot Abijah: Abijah begot Asa:

sinaiticus.text: Asa begot Jehosaphat: Jehosaphat begot Jehoram: Jehoram begot Uzziah:

verses.text: Asa begot Jehosaphat: Jehosaphat begot Jehoram: Jehoram begot Uzziah:

sinaiticus.text: Uzziah begot Jotham: Jotham begot Ahaz: Ahaz begot Hezekiah:

verses.text: Uzziah begot Jotham: Jotham begot Ahaz: Ahaz begot Hezekiah:

sinaiticus.text: Hezekiah begot Manasseh: Manasseh begot Amon: Amon begot Josiah:

verses.text: Hezekiah begot Manasseh: Manasseh begot Amon: Amon begot Josiah:

sinaiticus.text: Josiah begot Jeconiah and his brothers about the time of the removal to Babylon.

verses.text: Josiah begot Jeconiah and his brothers about the time of the removal to Babylon.

sinaiticus.text: But after the removal to Babylon, Jeconiah begot Shealtiel: Shealtiel begot Zerubbabel:

verses.text: But after the removal to Babylon, Jeconiah begot Shealtiel: Shealtiel begot Zerubbabel:

sinaiticus.text: Zerubbabel begot Abihud: Abihud begot Eliakim: Eliakim begot Azor:

verses.text: Zerubbabel begot Abihud: Abihud begot Eliakim: Eliakim begot Azor:

sinaiticus.text: Azor begot Zadoc: Zadoc begot Achim: Achim begot Eliud:

verses.text: Azor begot Zadoc: Zadoc begot Achim: Achim begot Eliud:

sinaiticus.text: Eliud begot Eleazar: Eleazar begot Matthan: Matthan begot Jacob:

verses.text: Eliud begot Eleazar: Eleazar begot Matthan: Matthan begot Jacob:

sinaiticus.text: Jacob begot Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus who is called Christ.

verses.text: Jacob begot Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus who is called Christ.

sinaiticus.text: So all the generations from Abraham till David, are fourteen generations; and from David till the removal to Babylon, are fourteen generations; and from the removal to Babylon till Christ, are fourteen generations.

verses.text: So all the generations from Abraham till David, are fourteen generations; and from David till the removal to Babylon, are fourteen generations; and from the removal to Babylon till Christ, are fourteen generations.

sinaiticus.text: But the birth of Jesus Christ was thus: After his mother Mary had been betrothed to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child of the Holy Spirit.

verses.text: But the birth of Jesus Christ was thus: After his mother Mary had been betrothed to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child of the Holy Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: And Joseph her husband, being just and not willing to make her an example, intended to put her away privately.

verses.text: And Joseph her husband, being just and not willing to make her an example, intended to put her away privately.

sinaiticus.text: But while he thought of these things, behold, an angel of the Lord take to thee Mary thy wife; for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.

verses.text: But while he thought of these things, behold, an angel of the Lord take to thee Mary thy wife; for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: And she shall bear a son, and thou shalt call his name Jesus; for he shall save his people from their sins.

verses.text: And she shall bear a son, and thou shalt call his name Jesus; for he shall save his people from their sins.

sinaiticus.text: And all this was done, that it might be fulfilled that was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying:

verses.text: And all this was done, that it might be fulfilled that was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying:

sinaiticus.text: Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and shall bear a son, and they shall call his name Immanuel, which is, when translated, God with us.

verses.text: Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and shall bear a son, and they shall call his name Immanuel, which is, when translated, God with us.

sinaiticus.text: And Joseph arose from his sleep, and did as the angel of the Lord had commanded him, and took to him his wife; and knew her not till she had brought forth a son; and he called his name Jesus.

verses.text: And Joseph arose from his sleep, and did as the angel of the Lord had commanded him, and took to him his wife; and knew her not till she had brought forth a son; and he called his name Jesus.

sinaiticus.text: But after Jesus had been born in Bethlehem of Judea, in the days of Herod the king, behold, Magi from the east came to Jerusalem,

verses.text: But after Jesus had been born in Bethlehem of Judea, in the days of Herod the king, behold, Magi from the east came to Jerusalem,

sinaiticus.text: saying: Where is he that has been born king of the Jews? For we saw his star at its rising, and have come to worship him.

verses.text: saying: Where is he that has been born king of the Jews? For we saw his star at its rising, and have come to worship him.

sinaiticus.text: And hearing it, king Herod was alarmed, and all Jerusalem with him.

verses.text: And hearing it, king Herod was alarmed, and all Jerusalem with him.

sinaiticus.text: And he assembled all the chief priests and scribes of the people, and inquired of them where the Christ should be born.

verses.text: And he assembled all the chief priests and scribes of the people, and inquired of them where the Christ should be born.

sinaiticus.text: And they said to him: In Bethlehem of Judea; for thus it is written by the prophet:

verses.text: And they said to him: In Bethlehem of Judea; for thus it is written by the prophet:

sinaiticus.text: And thou, Bethlehem, land of Judah, art by no means the least among the princes of Judah; for out of thee shall come a Governor, who shall rule my people Israel.

verses.text: And thou, Bethlehem, land of Judah, art by no means the least among the princes of Judah; for out of thee shall come a Governor, who shall rule my people Israel.

sinaiticus.text: Then Herod having secretly called the Magi, inquired of them strictly the time at which the star appeared;

verses.text: Then Herod having secretly called the Magi, inquired of them strictly the time at which the star appeared;

sinaiticus.text: and sending them to Bethlehem, said: Go, make strict inquiry for the young child: and when you have found him, bring me word, that I also may go and worship him.

verses.text: and sending them to Bethlehem, said: Go, make strict inquiry for the young child: and when you have found him, bring me word, that I also may go and worship him.

sinaiticus.text: And after hearing the king, they departed; and lo, the star which they had seen at its rising, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.

verses.text: And after hearing the king, they departed; and lo, the star which they had seen at its rising, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.

sinaiticus.text: And when they saw the star, they rejoiced with very great joy.

verses.text: And when they saw the star, they rejoiced with very great joy.

sinaiticus.text: And coming into the house, they saw the young child with Mary his mother; and falling down they worshipped him; and having opened their treasures they offered to him gifts, gold, and frankincense, and myrrh.

verses.text: And coming into the house, they saw the young child with Mary his mother; and falling down they worshipped him; and having opened their treasures they offered to him gifts, gold, and frankincense, and myrrh.

sinaiticus.text: And having been warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they withdrew into their own country by another way.

verses.text: And having been warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they withdrew into their own country by another way.

sinaiticus.text: But after they had withdrawn, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying: Arise, and take the young16 child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be there till I bring thee word; for Herod is about to seek for the young child, to destroy him.

verses.text: But after they had withdrawn, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying: Arise, and take the young16 child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be there till I bring thee word; for Herod is about to seek for the young child, to destroy him.

sinaiticus.text: And he arose and took the young child and his mother, by night, and withdrew into Egypt,

verses.text: And he arose and took the young child and his mother, by night, and withdrew into Egypt,

sinaiticus.text: and was there till the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled that was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying: Out of Egypt I called my Son.

verses.text: and was there till the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled that was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying: Out of Egypt I called my Son.

sinaiticus.text: Then Herod, seeing that he had been deceived by the Magi, was greatly enraged; and, having sent out, he slew all the male children that were in Bethlehem, and in all its borders, from the age of two years and under, according to the time which he had strictly inquired of the Magi.

verses.text: Then Herod, seeing that he had been deceived by the Magi, was greatly enraged; and, having sent out, he slew all the male children that were in Bethlehem, and in all its borders, from the age of two years and under, according to the time which he had strictly inquired of the Magi.

sinaiticus.text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet, saying:

verses.text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet, saying:

sinaiticus.text: A voice was heard in Ramah, wailing and great mourning: Rachel weeping for her children; and she would not be comforted because they are no more.

verses.text: A voice was heard in Ramah, wailing and great mourning: Rachel weeping for her children; and she would not be comforted because they are no more.

sinaiticus.text: But after Herod had died, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

verses.text: But after Herod had died, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

sinaiticus.text: saying: Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel; for they are dead that sought the young child’s life.

verses.text: saying: Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel; for they are dead that sought the young child’s life.

sinaiticus.text: And he arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

verses.text: And he arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

sinaiticus.text: But hearing that Archelaus reigned in Judea, in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither; but being warned in a dream, he withdrew into the regions of Galilee,

verses.text: But hearing that Archelaus reigned in Judea, in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither; but being warned in a dream, he withdrew into the regions of Galilee,

sinaiticus.text: and came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth, that it might be fulfilled that was spoken through the prophets: He shall be called a Nazarene.

verses.text: and came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth, that it might be fulfilled that was spoken through the prophets: He shall be called a Nazarene.

sinaiticus.text: But in those days came John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judea,

verses.text: But in those days came John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judea,

sinaiticus.text: saying: Repent, for the kingdom of the heavens is at hand.

verses.text: saying: Repent, for the kingdom of the heavens is at hand.

sinaiticus.text: For this is he that was spoken of through Isaiah the prophet, saying: The voice of one crying in the wilderness. Prepare the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.

verses.text: For this is he that was spoken of through Isaiah the prophet, saying: The voice of one crying in the wilderness. Prepare the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.

sinaiticus.text: But the same John had his clothing of camel’s hair, and a girdle of leather around his loins, and his food was locusts and wild honey.

verses.text: But the same John had his clothing of camel’s hair, and a girdle of leather around his loins, and his food was locusts and wild honey.

sinaiticus.text: Then went out to him Jerusalem, and all Judea, and all the region round about the Jordan,

verses.text: Then went out to him Jerusalem, and all Judea, and all the region round about the Jordan,

sinaiticus.text: But seeing many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said to them: Brood of vipers, who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?

verses.text: But seeing many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said to them: Brood of vipers, who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?

sinaiticus.text: Bring forth therefore fruit worthy of repentance,

verses.text: Bring forth therefore fruit worthy of repentance,

sinaiticus.text: and think not to say within yourselves: We have Abraham for a father; for I say to you that God is able of these stones to raise up children for Abraham.

verses.text: and think not to say within yourselves: We have Abraham for a father; for I say to you that God is able of these stones to raise up children for Abraham.

sinaiticus.text: And now the ax is lying at the root of the trees: every tree, therefore, that brings not forth good fruit is cut down, and thrown into the fire.

verses.text: And now the ax is lying at the root of the trees: every tree, therefore, that brings not forth good fruit is cut down, and thrown into the fire.

sinaiticus.text: I indeed baptize you in water in order to repentance; but he that comes after me is mightier than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry: he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit and in fire:

verses.text: I indeed baptize you in water in order to repentance; but he that comes after me is mightier than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry: he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit and in fire:

sinaiticus.text: whose winnowing shovel is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor, and gather his grain into the granary; but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire.

verses.text: whose winnowing shovel is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor, and gather his grain into the granary; but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire.

sinaiticus.text: Then came Jesus from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptized by him.

verses.text: Then came Jesus from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptized by him.

sinaiticus.text: But he forbade him, saying: I have need to be baptized by thee, and comest thou to me?

verses.text: But he forbade him, saying: I have need to be baptized by thee, and comest thou to me?

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus answered and said to him: Permit it now; for thus it becomes us to fulfill every righteous act. Then he permitted him.

verses.text: But Jesus answered and said to him: Permit it now; for thus it becomes us to fulfill every righteous act. Then he permitted him.

sinaiticus.text: And having been baptized, Jesus immediately went up from the water; and lo, the heavens were opened, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and coming upon him.

verses.text: And having been baptized, Jesus immediately went up from the water; and lo, the heavens were opened, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and coming upon him.

sinaiticus.text: And lo, a voice from the heavens, saying: This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

verses.text: And lo, a voice from the heavens, saying: This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

sinaiticus.text: Then was Jesus led up by the Spirit into the wilderness, to be tempted by the devil.

verses.text: Then was Jesus led up by the Spirit into the wilderness, to be tempted by the devil.

sinaiticus.text: And having fasted forty days and forty nights, he was afterward hungry.

verses.text: And having fasted forty days and forty nights, he was afterward hungry.

sinaiticus.text: And the tempter came and said to him: If thou art the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.

verses.text: And the tempter came and said to him: If thou art the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.

sinaiticus.text: But he answered and said: It is written: Not by bread alone shall man live, but by every word that comes forth through the mouth of God.

verses.text: But he answered and said: It is written: Not by bread alone shall man live, but by every word that comes forth through the mouth of God.

sinaiticus.text: Then the devil took him into the holy city, and set him on the wing of the temple.

verses.text: Then the devil took him into the holy city, and set him on the wing of the temple.

sinaiticus.text: and said to him: If thou art the Son of God, cast thyself down; for it is written: He will give his angels charge concerning thee, and in their hands they shall take thee up, lest thou strike thy foot against a stone.18

verses.text: and said to him: If thou art the Son of God, cast thyself down; for it is written: He will give his angels charge concerning thee, and in their hands they shall take thee up, lest thou strike thy foot against a stone.18

sinaiticus.text: Jesus said to him: Again it is written: Thou shalt not put the Lord thy God to the proof.

verses.text: Jesus said to him: Again it is written: Thou shalt not put the Lord thy God to the proof.

sinaiticus.text: and said to him: All these will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me.

verses.text: and said to him: All these will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me.

verses.text: Then Jesus says to him: Get hence, Satan; for it is written: The Lord thy God thou shalt worship, and him only shalt thou serve

sinaiticus.text: Then the devil left him; and, behold, angels came and ministered to him.

verses.text: Then the devil left him; and, behold, angels came and ministered to him.

verses.text: But when he had heard that John was delivered up, he withdrew into Galilee;

sinaiticus.text: that it might be fulfilled that was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying:

sinaiticus.text: the people that sat in darkness saw great light; and upon those who sat in the region and shadow of death light arose.

verses.text: the people that sat in darkness saw great light; and upon those who sat in the region and shadow of death light arose.

sinaiticus.text: From that time Jesus began to preach and to say: Repent, for the kingdom of the heavens is at hand.

verses.text: From that time Jesus began to preach and to say: Repent, for the kingdom of the heavens is at hand.

sinaiticus.text: And walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother, throwing a net into the sea, for they were fishers.

verses.text: And walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother, throwing a net into the sea, for they were fishers.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to them: Come after me, and I will make you fishers of men.

verses.text: And he said to them: Come after me, and I will make you fishers of men.

sinaiticus.text: And they immediately left their nets and followed him.

verses.text: And they immediately left their nets and followed him.

sinaiticus.text: And going on thence, he saw other two brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets; and he called them.

verses.text: And going on thence, he saw other two brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets; and he called them.

sinaiticus.text: And immediately leaving the ship and their father, they followed him.

verses.text: And immediately leaving the ship and their father, they followed him.

sinaiticus.text: And he went about in the whole of Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and curing every disease and every malady among the people.

verses.text: And he went about in the whole of Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and curing every disease and every malady among the people.

sinaiticus.text: And his fame went abroad into the whole of Syria; and they brought to him all that were sick with various diseases, and that were afflicted with torments, and those possessed with demons, and lunatics, and paralytics; and he cured them.

verses.text: And his fame went abroad into the whole of Syria; and they brought to him all that were sick with various diseases, and that were afflicted with torments, and those possessed with demons, and lunatics, and paralytics; and he cured them.

sinaiticus.text: And there followed him many multitudes from Galilee, and Decapolis, and Jerusalem, and Judea, and from beyond the Jordan.

verses.text: And there followed him many multitudes from Galilee, and Decapolis, and Jerusalem, and Judea, and from beyond the Jordan.

sinaiticus.text: But seeing the multitudes, he went up into the mountain; and when he had sat down, his disciples came to him;

verses.text: and he opened his mouth and taught them, saying:

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are the poor in spirit; for theirs is the kingdom of the heavens.

verses.text: Blessed are the poor in spirit; for theirs is the kingdom of the heavens.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are the meek; for they shall inherit the earth.

verses.text: Blessed are the meek; for they shall inherit the earth.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are they that mourn; for they shall be comforted.

verses.text: Blessed are they that mourn; for they shall be comforted.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are they that hunger and thirst for righteousness; for they shall be filled.

verses.text: Blessed are they that hunger and thirst for righteousness; for they shall be filled.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are the merciful; for they shall receive mercy.

verses.text: Blessed are the merciful; for they shall receive mercy.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are the pure in heart; for they shall see God.

verses.text: Blessed are the pure in heart; for they shall see God.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are the peacemakers; for they shall be called sons of God.

verses.text: Blessed are the peacemakers; for they shall be called sons of God.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are they that are persecuted for righteousness’ sake; for theirs is the kingdom of the heavens.

verses.text: Blessed are they that are persecuted for righteousness’ sake; for theirs is the kingdom of the heavens.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are you when they shall reproach you, and persecute you, and say every evil thing against you falsely for my sake.

verses.text: Blessed are you when they shall reproach you, and persecute you, and say every evil thing against you falsely for my sake.

sinaiticus.text: Rejoice, and be exceeding glad; for great is your reward in the heavens; for so persecuted they the prophets that were before you.

verses.text: Rejoice, and be exceeding glad; for great is your reward in the heavens; for so persecuted they the prophets that were before you.

sinaiticus.text: You are the salt of the earth; but if the salt shall have become tasteless, by what means shall it be salted? It is then good for nothing but, after being cast out, to be trod upon by men.

verses.text: You are the salt of the earth; but if the salt shall have become tasteless, by what means shall it be salted? It is then good for nothing but, after being cast out, to be trod upon by men.

sinaiticus.text: You are the light of the world. A city that lies upon a mountain cannot be hid:

verses.text: You are the light of the world. A city that lies upon a mountain cannot be hid:

sinaiticus.text: neither do men light a lamp and put it under the measure, but on the lampstand, and it gives light to all that are in the house.

verses.text: neither do men light a lamp and put it under the measure, but on the lampstand, and it gives light to all that are in the house.

sinaiticus.text: So let your light shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father who is in the heavens.

verses.text: So let your light shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father who is in the heavens.

sinaiticus.text: Think not that I have come to destroy the law or the prophets: I have not come to destroy, but to fulfill.

verses.text: Think not that I have come to destroy the law or the prophets: I have not come to destroy, but to fulfill.

sinaiticus.text: For verily I say to you, till heaven and earth pass away, one yod or one point shall in no way pass from the law, till all be accomplished.

verses.text: For verily I say to you, till heaven and earth pass away, one yod or one point shall in no way pass from the law, till all be accomplished.

sinaiticus.text: Whoever therefore shall make void one of the least of these commandments, and shall teach men so, shall be called least in the kingdom of the heavens; but whoever shall do and teach, he shall be called great in the kingdom of the heavens,

verses.text: Whoever therefore shall make void one of the least of these commandments, and shall teach men so, shall be called least in the kingdom of the heavens; but whoever shall do and teach, he shall be called great in the kingdom of the heavens,

sinaiticus.text: For I say to you, that unless your righteousness shall be more abundant than that of the scribes and Pharisees, you can by no means enter into the kingdom of the heavens.

verses.text: For I say to you, that unless your righteousness shall be more abundant than that of the scribes and Pharisees, you can by no means enter into the kingdom of the heavens.

sinaiticus.text: You have heard that it was said to the ancients: Thou shalt not kill; and whoever shall kill shall be liable to the judgment.

verses.text: You have heard that it was said to the ancients: Thou shalt not kill; and whoever shall kill shall be liable to the judgment.

sinaiticus.text: But I say to you, that whoever is angry with his brother shall be liable to the judgment; and whoever shall say to his brother.20 Worthless fellow, shall be liable to the Sanhedrim; but whoever shall say: Thou fool, shall be liable to be cast into hellfire.

verses.text: But I say to you, that whoever is angry with his brother shall be liable to the judgment; and whoever shall say to his brother.20 Worthless fellow, shall be liable to the Sanhedrim; but whoever shall say: Thou fool, shall be liable to be cast into hellfire.

sinaiticus.text: If therefore thou bring thy gift to the altar, and there remember that thy brother has anything against thee,

verses.text: If therefore thou bring thy gift to the altar, and there remember that thy brother has anything against thee,

sinaiticus.text: leave there thy gift before the altar, and go, first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.

verses.text: leave there thy gift before the altar, and go, first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.

sinaiticus.text: Agree with thy opponent-at-law quickly, while thou art on the road with him, lest perhaps the opponent-at-law deliver thee to the judge, and the judge to the officer, and thou be cast into prison.

verses.text: Agree with thy opponent-at-law quickly, while thou art on the road with him, lest perhaps the opponent-at-law deliver thee to the judge, and the judge to the officer, and thou be cast into prison.

sinaiticus.text: Verily I say to thee, thou shalt not come out thence, till thou shalt have paid the last farthing.

verses.text: Verily I say to thee, thou shalt not come out thence, till thou shalt have paid the last farthing.

sinaiticus.text: You have heard that it was said: Thou shalt not commit adultery.

verses.text: You have heard that it was said: Thou shalt not commit adultery.

sinaiticus.text: But I say to you, That every one that looks on a woman to cherish desire, has already committed adultery with her in his heart.

verses.text: But I say to you, That every one that looks on a woman to cherish desire, has already committed adultery with her in his heart.

sinaiticus.text: But if thy right eye ensnares thee, pull it out, and throw it from thee; for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members perish, and not that thy whole body be thrown into hell.

verses.text: But if thy right eye ensnares thee, pull it out, and throw it from thee; for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members perish, and not that thy whole body be thrown into hell.

sinaiticus.text: And if thy right hand ensnares thee, cut it off, and throw it from thee; for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members perish, and not that thy whole body go away into hell.

verses.text: And if thy right hand ensnares thee, cut it off, and throw it from thee; for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members perish, and not that thy whole body go away into hell.

sinaiticus.text: And it has been said: Whoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a bill of divorce.

verses.text: And it has been said: Whoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a bill of divorce.

sinaiticus.text: But I say to you, that whoever shalt put away his wife, unless on account of lewdness, causes her to commit adultery; and whoever shall marry her that is put away commits adultery.

verses.text: But I say to you, that whoever shalt put away his wife, unless on account of lewdness, causes her to commit adultery; and whoever shall marry her that is put away commits adultery.

sinaiticus.text: Again: you have heard that it was said to the ancients: Thou shalt not swear falsely, but shalt pay to the Lord thy oaths.

verses.text: Again: you have heard that it was said to the ancients: Thou shalt not swear falsely, but shalt pay to the Lord thy oaths.

sinaiticus.text: But I say to you, Swear not at all; neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God;

verses.text: But I say to you, Swear not at all; neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God;

sinaiticus.text: nor by the earth, for it is his footstool; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King:

verses.text: nor by the earth, for it is his footstool; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King:

sinaiticus.text: neither shalt thou swear by thy head, for thou canst not make one hair white or black.

verses.text: neither shalt thou swear by thy head, for thou canst not make one hair white or black.

sinaiticus.text: But let your word be yes, yes; no, no; and that which is more than these is of the evil one.

verses.text: But let your word be yes, yes; no, no; and that which is more than these is of the evil one.

sinaiticus.text: You have heard that it was said: Eye for eye, and tooth for tooth.

verses.text: You have heard that it was said: Eye for eye, and tooth for tooth.

sinaiticus.text: But I say to you, that you resist not the injurious; but whoever shall smite thee on the right cheek, turn to him the other also.

verses.text: But I say to you, that you resist not the injurious; but whoever shall smite thee on the right cheek, turn to him the other also.

sinaiticus.text: And to him that will go to law with thee, and take away thy coat, give up thy mantle also.

verses.text: And to him that will go to law with thee, and take away thy coat, give up thy mantle also.

sinaiticus.text: And whoever will impress thee to go one mile, go with him two.

verses.text: And whoever will impress thee to go one mile, go with him two.

sinaiticus.text: You have heard that it was said: Thou shalt love thy neighbor, and hate thy enemy.

verses.text: You have heard that it was said: Thou shalt love thy neighbor, and hate thy enemy.

sinaiticus.text: But I say to you. Love your enemies, and pray for them that persecute you;

verses.text: But I say to you. Love your enemies, and pray for them that persecute you;

sinaiticus.text: that you may become sons of your Father who is in the heavens; for he makes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends his rain on the just and the unjust.

verses.text: that you may become sons of your Father who is in the heavens; for he makes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends his rain on the just and the unjust.

sinaiticus.text: For if you love them that love you, what reward have you? Do not even the publicans the same?

verses.text: For if you love them that love you, what reward have you? Do not even the publicans the same?

sinaiticus.text: And if you salute your brethren only, what do you more? Do not even the heathen the same?

verses.text: And if you salute your brethren only, what do you more? Do not even the heathen the same?

sinaiticus.text: Be you therefore perfect as your heavenly Father is perfect.

verses.text: Be you therefore perfect as your heavenly Father is perfect.

sinaiticus.text: But take heed that you do not your righteousness before men, to be seen by them: other wise you have no reward with your Father who is in the heavens.

verses.text: But take heed that you do not your righteousness before men, to be seen by them: other wise you have no reward with your Father who is in the heavens.

sinaiticus.text: When therefore thou wouldst do a charitable deed, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues, and in the streets, that they may be glorified by men. Verily I say to you: They have their reward in full.

verses.text: When therefore thou wouldst do a charitable deed, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues, and in the streets, that they may be glorified by men. Verily I say to you: They have their reward in full.

sinaiticus.text: But when thou doest a charitable deed, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand does;

verses.text: But when thou doest a charitable deed, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand does;

sinaiticus.text: that thy charitable deed may be in secret; and thy Father who sees in secret will reward thee.

verses.text: that thy charitable deed may be in secret; and thy Father who sees in secret will reward thee.

sinaiticus.text: And when you pray, you shall not be as the hypocrites; for they love to pray standing in the synagogues, and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Verily I say to you: They have their reward in full.

verses.text: And when you pray, you shall not be as the hypocrites; for they love to pray standing in the synagogues, and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Verily I say to you: They have their reward in full.

sinaiticus.text: But thou, when thou prayest, go into thy closet; and having closed thy door, pray to thy Father who is in secret; and thy Father who sees in secret will reward thee.

verses.text: But thou, when thou prayest, go into thy closet; and having closed thy door, pray to thy Father who is in secret; and thy Father who sees in secret will reward thee.

sinaiticus.text: But when you pray, use not vain repetitions as the heathens; for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.

verses.text: But when you pray, use not vain repetitions as the heathens; for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.

sinaiticus.text: Be not therefore like them; for your Father knows what things you have need of before you ask him.

verses.text: Be not therefore like them; for your Father knows what things you have need of before you ask him.

sinaiticus.text: In this way therefore pray you: Our Father who art in the heavens: hallowed be thy name.

verses.text: In this way therefore pray you: Our Father who art in the heavens: hallowed be thy name.

sinaiticus.text: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done as in heaven also on earth.

verses.text: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done as in heaven also on earth.

sinaiticus.text: Give us this day our needful bread.

verses.text: Give us this day our needful bread.

sinaiticus.text: And forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors;

verses.text: And forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors;

sinaiticus.text: and lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one.22

verses.text: and lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one.22

sinaiticus.text: For if you forgive men their offenses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you;

verses.text: For if you forgive men their offenses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you;

sinaiticus.text: but if you for give not men, neither will your Father forgive your offenses.

verses.text: but if you for give not men, neither will your Father forgive your offenses.

sinaiticus.text: And when you fast, be not as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance; for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear to men to fast. Verily I say to you, They have their reward in full.

verses.text: And when you fast, be not as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance; for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear to men to fast. Verily I say to you, They have their reward in full.

sinaiticus.text: But do thou, when fasting, anoint thy head, and wash thy face,

verses.text: But do thou, when fasting, anoint thy head, and wash thy face,

sinaiticus.text: that thou appear not to men to fast, but to thy Father who is in secret; and thy Father who sees in secret will reward thee.

verses.text: that thou appear not to men to fast, but to thy Father who is in secret; and thy Father who sees in secret will reward thee.

sinaiticus.text: Lay not up for yourselves treasures on the earth, where moth and rust consume, and where thieves break through and steal;

verses.text: Lay not up for yourselves treasures on the earth, where moth and rust consume, and where thieves break through and steal;

sinaiticus.text: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust consumes, and where thieves do not break through nor steal.

verses.text: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust consumes, and where thieves do not break through nor steal.

sinaiticus.text: For where thy treasure is, there will thy heart be also.

verses.text: For where thy treasure is, there will thy heart be also.

sinaiticus.text: The lamp of the body is the eye. If thy eye be simple thy whole body shall be full of light;

verses.text: The lamp of the body is the eye. If thy eye be simple thy whole body shall be full of light;

sinaiticus.text: but if thy eye be evil thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If then the light that is in thee is darkness, how great that darkness.

verses.text: but if thy eye be evil thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If then the light that is in thee is darkness, how great that darkness.

sinaiticus.text: No one can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other or he will hold to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and Mammon.

verses.text: No one can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other or he will hold to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and Mammon.

sinaiticus.text: For this reason I say to you: Be not anxious for your life what you shall eat, nor for your body what you shall put on. Is not the life more than the food, and the body than the clothing?

verses.text: For this reason I say to you: Be not anxious for your life what you shall eat, nor for your body what you shall put on. Is not the life more than the food, and the body than the clothing?

sinaiticus.text: Look at the birds of heaven, that they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into granaries; and yet your heavenly Father feeds them: are you not much better than they?

verses.text: Look at the birds of heaven, that they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into granaries; and yet your heavenly Father feeds them: are you not much better than they?

sinaiticus.text: But which of you, by being anxious, can add one cubit to his age?

verses.text: But which of you, by being anxious, can add one cubit to his age?

sinaiticus.text: And why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow: they toil not, nor do they spin.

verses.text: And why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow: they toil not, nor do they spin.

sinaiticus.text: But I say to you, that even Solomon in all his glory was not clothed as one of these.

verses.text: But I say to you, that even Solomon in all his glory was not clothed as one of these.

sinaiticus.text: Now if God so clothes the herb of the field, which today is, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, will he not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?

verses.text: Now if God so clothes the herb of the field, which today is, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, will he not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?

sinaiticus.text: Then, be not anxious, saying: What shall we eat, or what shall we drink, or with what shall we be clothed?

verses.text: Then, be not anxious, saying: What shall we eat, or what shall we drink, or with what shall we be clothed?

sinaiticus.text: For after all these things do the Gentiles seek; for your heavenly Father knows that you need all these.

verses.text: For after all these things do the Gentiles seek; for your heavenly Father knows that you need all these.

sinaiticus.text: But seek first his kingdom and righteousness, and all these shall be given you in addition.

verses.text: But seek first his kingdom and righteousness, and all these shall be given you in addition.

sinaiticus.text: Be not therefore anxious for the morrow; for the morrow shall be

verses.text: Be not therefore anxious for the morrow; for the morrow shall be

sinaiticus.text: Judge not that you be not judged.

verses.text: Judge not that you be not judged.

sinaiticus.text: For with what judgment you judge, you shall be judged, and with what measure you measure, it shall be measured to you.

verses.text: For with what judgment you judge, you shall be judged, and with what measure you measure, it shall be measured to you.

sinaiticus.text: And why beholdest thou the splinter that is in thy brother’s eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thy own eye?

verses.text: And why beholdest thou the splinter that is in thy brother’s eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thy own eye?

sinaiticus.text: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother: Let me pull the splinter out of thy eye, and behold, the beam is in thy own eye.

verses.text: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother: Let me pull the splinter out of thy eye, and behold, the beam is in thy own eye.

sinaiticus.text: Hypocrite, pull first the beam out of thy own eye, and then thou shalt see clearly to pull the splinter out of thy brother’s eye.

verses.text: Hypocrite, pull first the beam out of thy own eye, and then thou shalt see clearly to pull the splinter out of thy brother’s eye.

sinaiticus.text: Give not that which is holy to dogs, neither throw your pearls before swine, less they trample them with their feet, and turn and tear you.

verses.text: Give not that which is holy to dogs, neither throw your pearls before swine, less they trample them with their feet, and turn and tear you.

sinaiticus.text: Ask, and it shall be given you: seek, and you shall find: knock, and it shall be opened to you.

verses.text: Ask, and it shall be given you: seek, and you shall find: knock, and it shall be opened to you.

sinaiticus.text: For every one that asks receives; and he that seeks finds; and to him that knocks it shall be opened.

verses.text: For every one that asks receives; and he that seeks finds; and to him that knocks it shall be opened.

sinaiticus.text: Or what man is there of you, of whom should his son ask bread, will he give him a stone?

verses.text: Or what man is there of you, of whom should his son ask bread, will he give him a stone?

sinaiticus.text: or if he should also ask a fish, will he give him a serpent?

verses.text: or if he should also ask a fish, will he give him a serpent?

sinaiticus.text: If then you being evil know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in the heavens give good gifts to those who ask him?

verses.text: If then you being evil know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in the heavens give good gifts to those who ask him?

sinaiticus.text: All things therefore whatever you would that men should do to you, even so do you to them; for this is the law and the prophets.

verses.text: All things therefore whatever you would that men should do to you, even so do you to them; for this is the law and the prophets.

sinaiticus.text: Enter in through the strait gate; for wide the gate and broad the way that leads to destruction; and many are they that go in through it;

verses.text: Enter in through the strait gate; for wide the gate and broad the way that leads to destruction; and many are they that go in through it;

sinaiticus.text: for strait is the gate, and narrow the way that leads to life, and few are they that find it.

verses.text: for strait is the gate, and narrow the way that leads to life, and few are they that find it.

sinaiticus.text: Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but within are ravenous wolves.

verses.text: Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but within are ravenous wolves.

sinaiticus.text: By their fruits you shall know them. Do men gather grapes from thorns, or figs from thistles?

verses.text: By their fruits you shall know them. Do men gather grapes from thorns, or figs from thistles?

sinaiticus.text: So every good tree produces goodly fruit; but the corrupt tree produces evil fruit.

verses.text: So every good tree produces goodly fruit; but the corrupt tree produces evil fruit.

sinaiticus.text: A good tree cannot produce evil fruit; neither can a corrupt tree produce goodly fruit.

verses.text: A good tree cannot produce evil fruit; neither can a corrupt tree produce goodly fruit.

sinaiticus.text: Every tree that does not produce goodly fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.

verses.text: Every tree that does not produce goodly fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore, by their fruits you shall know them.24

verses.text: Therefore, by their fruits you shall know them.24

sinaiticus.text: Not every one that says to me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of the heavens, but he that does the will of my Father who is in the heavens.

verses.text: Not every one that says to me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of the heavens, but he that does the will of my Father who is in the heavens.

sinaiticus.text: Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy by thy name, and by thy name cast out demons, and by thy name do many mighty works?

verses.text: Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy by thy name, and by thy name cast out demons, and by thy name do many mighty works?

sinaiticus.text: And then will I confess to them, I never knew you: depart from me, you that work iniquity.

verses.text: And then will I confess to them, I never knew you: depart from me, you that work iniquity.

sinaiticus.text: Every one therefore that hears these words of mine and does them, shall be likened to a wise man, who built his house on the rock.

verses.text: Every one therefore that hears these words of mine and does them, shall be likened to a wise man, who built his house on the rock.

sinaiticus.text: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and they beat upon that house, and it fell not; for it was founded on the rock.

verses.text: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and they beat upon that house, and it fell not; for it was founded on the rock.

sinaiticus.text: And every one that hears these words of mine, and does them not, shall be likened to a foolish man who built his house upon the sand.

verses.text: And every one that hears these words of mine, and does them not, shall be likened to a foolish man who built his house upon the sand.

sinaiticus.text: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and they beat upon that house, and it fell; and great was its fall.

verses.text: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and they beat upon that house, and it fell; and great was its fall.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass when Jesus had finished these words, the multitudes were astonished at his teaching;

verses.text: And it came to pass when Jesus had finished these words, the multitudes were astonished at his teaching;

sinaiticus.text: for he taught them as having authority and not as their scribes.

verses.text: for he taught them as having authority and not as their scribes.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had come down from the mountain, many multitudes followed him.

verses.text: And when he had come down from the mountain, many multitudes followed him.

sinaiticus.text: And behold, a leper came and worshipped him, saying: Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

verses.text: And behold, a leper came and worshipped him, saying: Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

sinaiticus.text: And he stretched forth his hand and touched him, saying: I will, be clean. And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

verses.text: And he stretched forth his hand and touched him, saying: I will, be clean. And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus said to him: See that thou tell no one; but go, show thyself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.

verses.text: And Jesus said to him: See that thou tell no one; but go, show thyself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.

verses.text: And when he had entered into Capernaum, there came to him a centurion beseeching him,

sinaiticus.text: and saying: Lord, my servant lies in my house palsied, fearfully tormented.

verses.text: and saying: Lord, my servant lies in my house palsied, fearfully tormented.

sinaiticus.text: He says to him: I will come and cure him.

verses.text: He says to him: I will come and cure him.

sinaiticus.text: But the centurion answering said: Lord, I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof; but speak only in a word, and my servant shall be restored to health.

verses.text: But the centurion answering said: Lord, I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof; but speak only in a word, and my servant shall be restored to health.

sinaiticus.text: For I am a man under authority, having soldiers under me; and I say to this one: Go, and he goes; and to another: Come, and he

sinaiticus.text: And hearing it Jesus was filled with admiration, and said to those that followed: Verily I say to you, not even in Israel have I found so great faith.

verses.text: And hearing it Jesus was filled with admiration, and said to those that followed: Verily I say to you, not even in Israel have I found so great faith.

sinaiticus.text: But I say to you, that many shall come from the east and the west, and shall recline at tables with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of the heavens;

verses.text: But I say to you, that many shall come from the east and the west, and shall recline at tables with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of the heavens;

verses.text: but the sons of the kingdom shall go forth into the darkness that is without: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus said to the centurion: Go; as thou hast believed, be it done for thee. And the servant was restored to health in that hour.

verses.text: And Jesus came into the house of Peter, and saw his mother-in- law lying and ill of a fever.

sinaiticus.text: And he touched her hand, and the fever left her; and she arose and ministered to him.

verses.text: And he touched her hand, and the fever left her; and she arose and ministered to him.

verses.text: But when evening had come, they brought to him many possessed with demons; and he cast out the spirits with a word, and cured all that were sick,

sinaiticus.text: that it might be fulfilled that was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying: Himself took our infirmities and bore our diseases.

verses.text: And a scribe came and said to him: Teacher, I will follow thee wherever thou goest.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus said to him: The foxes have dens, and the birds of the heaven have roosts, but the Son of man has not where he may lay his head.

verses.text: And Jesus said to him: The foxes have dens, and the birds of the heaven have roosts, but the Son of man has not where he may lay his head.

verses.text: And another of his disciples said to him: Lord, permit me first to go and bury my father.

sinaiticus.text: But he said to him: Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.

verses.text: But he said to him: Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.

sinaiticus.text: And after he had entered the ship, his disciples followed him.

verses.text: And after he had entered the ship, his disciples followed him.

verses.text: And behold, a great tempest arose in the sea, so that the ship was covered by the waves; but he was sleeping.

sinaiticus.text: And they came and awoke him, saying: Lord, save, we perish.

verses.text: And they came and awoke him, saying: Lord, save, we perish.

sinaiticus.text: And he says to them: Why are you fearful, O you of little faith? Then he arose and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm.

verses.text: And he says to them: Why are you fearful, O you of little faith? Then he arose and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm.

sinaiticus.text: And the men were astonished, saying: What manner of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him?

verses.text: And the men were astonished, saying: What manner of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him?

sinaiticus.text: And when he had come to the other side, into the country of the Gadarenes, there met him two men possessed with demons, coming out of the tombs, very fierce, so that no one could pass by that way.

verses.text: And when he had come to the other side, into the country of the Gadarenes, there met him two men possessed with demons, coming out of the tombs, very fierce, so that no one could pass by that way.

sinaiticus.text: And behold, they cried out, saying: What have we to do with thee, Son of God? Hast thou come hither before the time, to torment us?26

sinaiticus.text: And there was, at a distance from them, a herd of many swine feeding.

verses.text: And there was, at a distance from them, a herd of many swine feeding.

sinaiticus.text: How much better then, a man is than a sheep: so then it is lawful to do well on the sabbath.

sinaiticus.text: Whoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child, he is greatest in the kingdom of the heavens.

sinaiticus.text: And whoever shall receive one such little child in my name, receives me.

verses.text: And whoever shall receive one such little child in my name, receives me.

sinaiticus.text: But whoever shall offend one of these little ones that believe in me, it were better for him that an upper millstone were hung about his neck and he were drowned in the depth of the sea.

verses.text: But whoever shall offend one of these little ones that believe in me, it were better for him that an upper millstone were hung about his neck and he were drowned in the depth of the sea.

sinaiticus.text: Alas for the world because of offenses; for it is necessary that offenses come, yet alas for the man through whom the offense comes.

verses.text: Alas for the world because of offenses; for it is necessary that offenses come, yet alas for the man through whom the offense comes.

sinaiticus.text: But if thy hand or thy foot offends thee, cut it off and throw it from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life maimed or lame, than having two hands or two feet to be cast into the eternal fire.

verses.text: But if thy hand or thy foot offends thee, cut it off and throw it from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life maimed or lame, than having two hands or two feet to be cast into the eternal fire.

sinaiticus.text: And if thy eye offends thee, pull it out and throw it from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye, than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire.

verses.text: And if thy eye offends thee, pull it out and throw it from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye, than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire.

sinaiticus.text: Take heed that you despise not one of these little ones; for I say to you, that their angels in the heavens do always behold the face of my Father who is in the heavens.

verses.text: Take heed that you despise not one of these little ones; for I say to you, that their angels in the heavens do always behold the face of my Father who is in the heavens.

sinaiticus.text: For the Son of man has come to save that which is lost.

verses.text: For the Son of man has come to save that which is lost.

sinaiticus.text: What think you? If any man have a hundred sheep, and one of them go astray, does he not leave the ninety-nine on the mountains, and go and seek for that which went astray?

verses.text: What think you? If any man have a hundred sheep, and one of them go astray, does he not leave the ninety-nine on the mountains, and go and seek for that which went astray?

sinaiticus.text: And if it happen that he find it, verily I say to you, that he rejoices

verses.text: And if it happen that he find it, verily I say to you, that he rejoices

sinaiticus.text: So it is not the will of your Father who is in the heavens that one of these little ones perish.

verses.text: So it is not the will of your Father who is in the heavens that one of these little ones perish.

sinaiticus.text: And if thy brother sin, go, tell him of his fault between thee and him alone; if he hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother.

verses.text: And if thy brother sin, go, tell him of his fault between thee and him alone; if he hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother.

sinaiticus.text: But if he hear thee not, take with thee one or two more, that by the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.

verses.text: But if he hear thee not, take with thee one or two more, that by the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.

sinaiticus.text: But if he refuses to hear them, tell it to the church; and if he refuse to hear the church also, let him be to thee as a heathen and a publican.

verses.text: But if he refuses to hear them, tell it to the church; and if he refuse to hear the church also, let him be to thee as a heathen and a publican.

sinaiticus.text: Verily I say to you, whatever you shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven; and whatever you shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.

verses.text: Verily I say to you, whatever you shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven; and whatever you shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.

sinaiticus.text: Again, I say to you that if two of you on earth shall agree concerning any thing what ever they will ask, it shall be done for them by my Father who is in the heavens.

verses.text: Again, I say to you that if two of you on earth shall agree concerning any thing what ever they will ask, it shall be done for them by my Father who is in the heavens.

sinaiticus.text: For where there are two or three that have come together for my name, there am I in the midst of them.

verses.text: For where there are two or three that have come together for my name, there am I in the midst of them.

sinaiticus.text: Then came Peter and said to him: Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me and I forgive him? Till seven times?

verses.text: Then came Peter and said to him: Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me and I forgive him? Till seven times?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to him: I say not to thee, till seven times, but till seventy times seven.

verses.text: Jesus says to him: I say not to thee, till seven times, but till seventy times seven.

sinaiticus.text: For this reason the kingdom of the heavens is likened to a man, a king, who wished to take up a settlement with his servants.

verses.text: For this reason the kingdom of the heavens is likened to a man, a king, who wished to take up a settlement with his servants.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had begun to settle, there was brought to him one that owed him ten thousand talents.

verses.text: And when he had begun to settle, there was brought to him one that owed him ten thousand talents.

sinaiticus.text: And as he was not able to pay, the lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife, and his children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.

verses.text: And as he was not able to pay, the lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife, and his children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.

sinaiticus.text: Falling down therefore, that servant worshipped him, saying: Have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.

verses.text: Falling down therefore, that servant worshipped him, saying: Have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.

sinaiticus.text: And the lord of that servant moved with pity loosed him, and forgave him the debt.

verses.text: And the lord of that servant moved with pity loosed him, and forgave him the debt.

sinaiticus.text: But that servant went out and found one of his fellow servants that owed him a hundred denarii; and laying hold on him he took him by the throat, saying: Pay, if thou owest any thing.

verses.text: But that servant went out and found one of his fellow servants that owed him a hundred denarii; and laying hold on him he took him by the throat, saying: Pay, if thou owest any thing.

sinaiticus.text: Falling down therefore, his fellow servant besought him, saying: Have patience with me, and I will pay thee.

verses.text: Falling down therefore, his fellow servant besought him, saying: Have patience with me, and I will pay thee.

sinaiticus.text: But he would not; but went and threw him into prison till he should pay the debt.

verses.text: But he would not; but went and threw him into prison till he should pay the debt.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore his fellow servants seeing what had been done, were greatly grieved, and came and made known to their lord all that had been done.

verses.text: Therefore his fellow servants seeing what had been done, were greatly grieved, and came and made known to their lord all that had been done.

sinaiticus.text: Then his lord called him and said to him: Wicked servant, all that debt I forgave thee, because thou didst entreat me:46

verses.text: Then his lord called him and said to him: Wicked servant, all that debt I forgave thee, because thou didst entreat me:46

sinaiticus.text: did it not behoove thee also to have mercy onthy fellow servant, as I also had mercy on thee?

verses.text: did it not behoove thee also to have mercy onthy fellow servant, as I also had mercy on thee?

sinaiticus.text: And being angryhis lord delivered him to the tormentors, till he should pay all that was due him.

verses.text: And being angryhis lord delivered him to the tormentors, till he should pay all that was due him.

sinaiticus.text: So also will my heavenly Father do to you, if you from your hearts forgive not each one his brother.

verses.text: So also will my heavenly Father do to you, if you from your hearts forgive not each one his brother.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass when Jesus had finished these words, he departed from Galilee and came into the borders of Judea beyond the Jordan.

verses.text: And it came to pass when Jesus had finished these words, he departed from Galilee and came into the borders of Judea beyond the Jordan.

sinaiticus.text: And many multitudes followed him, and he cured them there.

verses.text: And many multitudes followed him, and he cured them there.

sinaiticus.text: And the Pharisees came to him, tempting him and saying: Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause?

verses.text: And the Pharisees came to him, tempting him and saying: Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause?

sinaiticus.text: And he answered and said: Have you not read that the Creator at the beginning made them male and female?

verses.text: And he answered and said: Have you not read that the Creator at the beginning made them male and female?

sinaiticus.text: and said: For this cause shall a man leave father and mother, and be joined to his wife, and the two shall be one flesh.

verses.text: and said: For this cause shall a man leave father and mother, and be joined to his wife, and the two shall be one flesh.

sinaiticus.text: So then no longer are they two, but one flesh. What therefore God has joined together, let not man put asunder.

verses.text: So then no longer are they two, but one flesh. What therefore God has joined together, let not man put asunder.

sinaiticus.text: They say to him: Why then did Moses command to give a bill of divorce and put her away?

verses.text: They say to him: Why then did Moses command to give a bill of divorce and put her away?

sinaiticus.text: He said to them: Moses because of the hardness of your heart permitted you to put away your wives; but from the beginning it was not so.

verses.text: He said to them: Moses because of the hardness of your heart permitted you to put away your wives; but from the beginning it was not so.

sinaiticus.text: But I say to you: Whoever puts away his wife unless for lewdness, and marries another, commits adultery.

verses.text: But I say to you: Whoever puts away his wife unless for lewdness, and marries another, commits adultery.

sinaiticus.text: The disciples say to him: If such is the case of the man with the wife, it is not good to marry.

verses.text: The disciples say to him: If such is the case of the man with the wife, it is not good to marry.

sinaiticus.text: But he said to them: All cannot receive this saying, but those to whom it is given.

verses.text: But he said to them: All cannot receive this saying, but those to whom it is given.

sinaiticus.text: For there are eunuchs who were born so from their mother’s womb; and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men; and there are eunuchs who have made themselves eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of the heavens. He that is able to receive it, let him receive it.

verses.text: For there are eunuchs who were born so from their mother’s womb; and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men; and there are eunuchs who have made themselves eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of the heavens. He that is able to receive it, let him receive it.

sinaiticus.text: Then were brought to him little children, that he might lay his hands on them and pray; but the disciples rebuked them.

verses.text: Then were brought to him little children, that he might lay his hands on them and pray; but the disciples rebuked them.

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus said to them: Let the little children alone and forbid them not to come to me; for to such belongs the kingdom of the heavens.

verses.text: But Jesus said to them: Let the little children alone and forbid them not to come to me; for to such belongs the kingdom of the heavens.

sinaiticus.text: And he laid his hands on them, and departed thence.

verses.text: And he laid his hands on them, and departed thence.

sinaiticus.text: And behold, one came to him and said: Teacher, what good thing

verses.text: And behold, one came to him and said: Teacher, what good thing

sinaiticus.text: And he said to him: Why dost thou ask me about the good? One is good. But if thou wilt enter into life, keep the commandments.

verses.text: And he said to him: Why dost thou ask me about the good? One is good. But if thou wilt enter into life, keep the commandments.

sinaiticus.text: Which said he. And Jesus said: Thou shalt not kill, thou shalt not commit adultery, thou shalt not steal, thou shalt not bear false testimony.

verses.text: Which said he. And Jesus said: Thou shalt not kill, thou shalt not commit adultery, thou shalt not steal, thou shalt not bear false testimony.

sinaiticus.text: honor thy father and thy mother, and, thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.

verses.text: honor thy father and thy mother, and, thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.

sinaiticus.text: The young man says to him: All these have I kept; what lack I yet?

verses.text: The young man says to him: All these have I kept; what lack I yet?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus said to him: If thou wilt be perfect, go sell thy goods, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven, and come follow me.

verses.text: Jesus said to him: If thou wilt be perfect, go sell thy goods, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven, and come follow me.

sinaiticus.text: And hearing it, the young man went away grieved; for he had great possessions.

verses.text: And hearing it, the young man went away grieved; for he had great possessions.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus said to his disciples: Verily I say to you, that a rich man will with difficulty enter into the kingdom of the heavens.

verses.text: And Jesus said to his disciples: Verily I say to you, that a rich man will with difficulty enter into the kingdom of the heavens.

sinaiticus.text: But again I say to you that it is easier for a camel to enter in through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of the heavens.

verses.text: But again I say to you that it is easier for a camel to enter in through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of the heavens.

sinaiticus.text: And the disciples hearing it were greatly astonished, saying: Who then can be saved?

verses.text: And the disciples hearing it were greatly astonished, saying: Who then can be saved?

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus looked on them and said to them: With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.

verses.text: But Jesus looked on them and said to them: With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.

sinaiticus.text: Then Peter answered and said to him: Behold, we have left all and followed thee: what therefore shall we have?

verses.text: Then Peter answered and said to him: Behold, we have left all and followed thee: what therefore shall we have?

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus said to them: Verily I say to you that you who have followed me, in the regeneration when the Son of man shall sit on the throne of his glory, you yourselves also shall sit on twelve thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

verses.text: And Jesus said to them: Verily I say to you that you who have followed me, in the regeneration when the Son of man shall sit on the throne of his glory, you yourselves also shall sit on twelve thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

sinaiticus.text: And every one that has left brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or children, or lands, or houses, for the sake of my name, shall receive many times more and shall inherit eternal life.

verses.text: And every one that has left brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or children, or lands, or houses, for the sake of my name, shall receive many times more and shall inherit eternal life.

sinaiticus.text: But many first shall be last and last first.

verses.text: But many first shall be last and last first.

sinaiticus.text: For the kingdom of the heavens is like a man a master of a house, who went out early in the morning to hire laborers into his vineyard.

verses.text: For the kingdom of the heavens is like a man a master of a house, who went out early in the morning to hire laborers into his vineyard.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had agreed with the laborers for a denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard.

verses.text: And when he had agreed with the laborers for a denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard.

sinaiticus.text: And he went out about the third hour, and saw others standing in the market idle,

verses.text: And he went out about the third hour, and saw others standing in the market idle,

verses.text: and he said to them: Go you also into the vineyard, and whatever may be right I will give you.

sinaiticus.text: And about the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing, and said to them: Why do you stand here all the day idle?

verses.text: And about the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing, and said to them: Why do you stand here all the day idle?

sinaiticus.text: They said to him: Because no one has hired us. He said to them: Go you also into the vineyard.

verses.text: They said to him: Because no one has hired us. He said to them: Go you also into the vineyard.

sinaiticus.text: And when evening had come the lord of the vineyard said to his steward: Call the laborers, and pay the hire, beginning from the last even to the first.

sinaiticus.text: And when those came who had been hired about the eleventh hour, they received each one a denarius.

sinaiticus.text: saying: These the last worked one hour, and thou hast made them equal to us who bore the burden of the day, and the heat.

sinaiticus.text: But he answered one of them and said: Friend, I do thee no wrong: didst thou not agree with I me for a denarius?

verses.text: But he answered one of them and said: Friend, I do thee no wrong: didst thou not agree with I me for a denarius?

sinaiticus.text: And seeing a fig tree on the road, he went to it, and found nothing on it, but leaves only; and he said to it: Let fruit grow from thee no more for ever. And the fig tree immediately withered.

sinaiticus.text: And the disciples seeing it were astonished, saying: How did the fig tree immediately wither?

verses.text: And the disciples seeing it were astonished, saying: How did the fig tree immediately wither?

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus answered and said to them: Verily I say to you, if you have faith and doubt not, you shall do not only this of the fig tree, but if you say even to this mountain: Be taken up, and be thrown into the sea, it shall be done.

verses.text: But Jesus answered and said to them: Verily I say to you, if you have faith and doubt not, you shall do not only this of the fig tree, but if you say even to this mountain: Be taken up, and be thrown into the sea, it shall be done.

sinaiticus.text: And all things whatever you shall ask in prayer believing, you shall receive.

verses.text: And all things whatever you shall ask in prayer believing, you shall receive.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had come into the temple, as he was teaching, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him, saying: By I what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority?

verses.text: And when he had come into the temple, as he was teaching, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him, saying: By I what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority?

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus answered and said to them: I also will ask you one word, which if you tell me, I also will tell you by what authority I do these things.

verses.text: But Jesus answered and said to them: I also will ask you one word, which if you tell me, I also will tell you by what authority I do these things.

sinaiticus.text: The baptism of John, whence was it? Of heaven or of men? And they reasoned with themselves, saying:

verses.text: The baptism of John, whence was it? Of heaven or of men? And they reasoned with themselves, saying:

sinaiticus.text: If we say: Of heaven, he will say to us: Why then did you not believe him? but if we say: Of men, we fear the multitude; for all hold John as a prophet.

verses.text: If we say: Of heaven, he will say to us: Why then did you not believe him? but if we say: Of men, we fear the multitude; for all hold John as a prophet.
