sinaiticus.text: But what think you? A man had two sons; coming to the first he said: Son, go, work today in the vineyard.

verses.text: But what think you? A man had two sons; coming to the first he said: Son, go, work today in the vineyard.

sinaiticus.text: But he answered and said: I will not; afterward he regretted it and went.

verses.text: But he answered and said: I will not; afterward he regretted it and went.

sinaiticus.text: And coming to the other he said in like manner. And he answered and said: I go, sir; and went not.

verses.text: And coming to the other he said in like manner. And he answered and said: I go, sir; and went not.

sinaiticus.text: Which of the two did the will of the father? They say: The first. Jesus says to them: Verily I say to you that the publicans and the harlots go before you into the kingdom of God.

verses.text: Which of the two did the will of the father? They say: The first. Jesus says to them: Verily I say to you that the publicans and the harlots go before you into the kingdom of God.

sinaiticus.text: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you believed him not; but the publicans and the harlots believed him; and you, when you saw it, afterwards felt no regret that you might believe him.

verses.text: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you believed him not; but the publicans and the harlots believed him; and you, when you saw it, afterwards felt no regret that you might believe him.

sinaiticus.text: Hear another parable. A man was master of a house, and he planted a vineyard, and put a hedge around it, and dug in it a wine press and built a tower, and let it out to vinedressers, and went into another country.

verses.text: Hear another parable. A man was master of a house, and he planted a vineyard, and put a hedge around it, and dug in it a wine press and built a tower, and let it out to vinedressers, and went into another country.

sinaiticus.text: But when the season of the fruits drew near, he sent his servants to the vine dressers, to receive his fruits.

verses.text: But when the season of the fruits drew near, he sent his servants to the vine dressers, to receive his fruits.

sinaiticus.text: And the vinedressers took his servants and scourged one, and killed another, and threw stones at another.

verses.text: And the vinedressers took his servants and scourged one, and killed another, and threw stones at another.

sinaiticus.text: Again he sent other servants more than the first, and they did to them in like manner.

verses.text: Again he sent other servants more than the first, and they did to them in like manner.

sinaiticus.text: But at last he sent to them his son, saying: They will reverence my son.

verses.text: But at last he sent to them his son, saying: They will reverence my son.

sinaiticus.text: But the vinedressers seeing the son said among themselves: This is the heir; come, let us kill him and have his inheritance.

verses.text: But the vinedressers seeing the son said among themselves: This is the heir; come, let us kill him and have his inheritance.

sinaiticus.text: And they took him, and cast him out of the vineyard, and killed him.

verses.text: And they took him, and cast him out of the vineyard, and killed him.

sinaiticus.text: When therefore the lord of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those vinedressers?

verses.text: When therefore the lord of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those vinedressers?

sinaiticus.text: They say to him: The wretches he will wretchedly destroy them, and the vineyard he will let out to other vinedressers, who will render to him the fruits in their seasons.

verses.text: They say to him: The wretches he will wretchedly destroy them, and the vineyard he will let out to other vinedressers, who will render to him the fruits in their seasons.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to them: Did you never read in the Scriptures: A stone which the builders rejected, this be came the head of the corner: this was from the Lord, and it is wondrous in our eyes?

verses.text: Jesus says to them: Did you never read in the Scriptures: A stone which the builders rejected, this be came the head of the corner: this was from the Lord, and it is wondrous in our eyes?

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore I say to you that the kingdom of God shall be taken from you, and shall be given to a nation bringing forth its fruits.

verses.text: Wherefore I say to you that the kingdom of God shall be taken from you, and shall be given to a nation bringing forth its fruits.

sinaiticus.text: And he that falls upon this stone shall be dashed to pieces; but him on whom it shall fall, it will make like chaff for the wind.

verses.text: And he that falls upon this stone shall be dashed to pieces; but him on whom it shall fall, it will make like chaff for the wind.

sinaiticus.text: But when the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they knew that he spoke of them;52

verses.text: But when the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they knew that he spoke of them;52

sinaiticus.text: and seeking to lay hold of him they feared the multitudes, because they held him as a prophet.

verses.text: and seeking to lay hold of him they feared the multitudes, because they held him as a prophet.

sinaiticus.text: And answering, Jesus again spoke to them in parables, saying:

verses.text: And answering, Jesus again spoke to them in parables, saying:

sinaiticus.text: The kingdom of the heavens is likened to a man, a king, who made a marriage for his son.

verses.text: The kingdom of the heavens is likened to a man, a king, who made a marriage for his son.

sinaiticus.text: And he sent forth his servants to call those that had been called to the marriage; and they would not come.

verses.text: And he sent forth his servants to call those that had been called to the marriage; and they would not come.

sinaiticus.text: Again he sent forth other servants, saying: Tell those who have been called: Behold, I have prepared my dinner, my oxen and the fallings are killed, and all things are ready: come to the marriage.

verses.text: Again he sent forth other servants, saying: Tell those who have been called: Behold, I have prepared my dinner, my oxen and the fallings are killed, and all things are ready: come to the marriage.

sinaiticus.text: But they were careless and went away, one to his farm, another to his merchandise.

verses.text: But they were careless and went away, one to his farm, another to his merchandise.

sinaiticus.text: But the rest, laying hold on his servants, outraged and slew them.

verses.text: But the rest, laying hold on his servants, outraged and slew them.

sinaiticus.text: And the king was angry, and sending his armies, he destroyed those murderers, and their city he set on fire.

verses.text: And the king was angry, and sending his armies, he destroyed those murderers, and their city he set on fire.

sinaiticus.text: Then said he to his servants: The marriage indeed is ready, but those who were called were not worthy.

verses.text: Then said he to his servants: The marriage indeed is ready, but those who were called were not worthy.

sinaiticus.text: Go therefore to the crossroads, and whoever you find call to the marriage.

verses.text: Go therefore to the crossroads, and whoever you find call to the marriage.

sinaiticus.text: And those servants went out into the roads, and brought together all as many as they found, both bad and good, and the bride chamber was filled with guests.

verses.text: And those servants went out into the roads, and brought together all as many as they found, both bad and good, and the bride chamber was filled with guests.

sinaiticus.text: But when the king came in to look upon the guests, he saw there a man that had not a wedding garment.

verses.text: But when the king came in to look upon the guests, he saw there a man that had not a wedding garment.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to him: Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment? But he was silent.

verses.text: And he said to him: Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment? But he was silent.

sinaiticus.text: Then the king said to the waiters: Bind his feet and hands and cast him into the darkness that is without: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

verses.text: Then the king said to the waiters: Bind his feet and hands and cast him into the darkness that is without: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

sinaiticus.text: For many are called, but few chosen.

verses.text: For many are called, but few chosen.

sinaiticus.text: Then went the Pharisees and took counsel that they might entrap him in a word.

verses.text: Then went the Pharisees and took counsel that they might entrap him in a word.

sinaiticus.text: And they send to him their disciples with the Herodians, saying: Teacher, we know that thou art true, and teachest the way of God in truth, and thou carest for no one, for thou lookest not on the person of men:

verses.text: And they send to him their disciples with the Herodians, saying: Teacher, we know that thou art true, and teachest the way of God in truth, and thou carest for no one, for thou lookest not on the person of men:

sinaiticus.text: tell us therefore, what thinkest thou? Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar or not?

verses.text: tell us therefore, what thinkest thou? Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar or not?

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus knowing their wickedness said: Why tempt me, hypocrites?

verses.text: But Jesus knowing their wickedness said: Why tempt me, hypocrites?

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus says to them: Whose image is this, and the superscription?

verses.text: And Jesus says to them: Whose image is this, and the superscription?

sinaiticus.text: They say: Caesar’s. Then says he to them: Render therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.

verses.text: They say: Caesar’s. Then says he to them: Render therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.

sinaiticus.text: And hearing they wondered, and leaving him they went away.

verses.text: And hearing they wondered, and leaving him they went away.

sinaiticus.text: In that day came to him Sadducees who say that there is no resurrection; and they asked him,

verses.text: In that day came to him Sadducees who say that there is no resurrection; and they asked him,

sinaiticus.text: saying: Teacher, Moses said: If any one die not having children, his brother shall marry his wife and raise up offspring for his brother.

verses.text: saying: Teacher, Moses said: If any one die not having children, his brother shall marry his wife and raise up offspring for his brother.

sinaiticus.text: Now there were with us seven brothers; and the first married and died; and not having offspring he left his wife to his brother.

verses.text: Now there were with us seven brothers; and the first married and died; and not having offspring he left his wife to his brother.

sinaiticus.text: In like manner also the second and the third, to the seventh.

verses.text: In like manner also the second and the third, to the seventh.

sinaiticus.text: But last of all, the woman died.

verses.text: But last of all, the woman died.

sinaiticus.text: In the resurrection, therefore, of which of the seven shall she be the wife? for all had her.

verses.text: In the resurrection, therefore, of which of the seven shall she be the wife? for all had her.

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus answered and said to them: You err, not knowing the Scriptures nor the power of God.

verses.text: But Jesus answered and said to them: You err, not knowing the Scriptures nor the power of God.

sinaiticus.text: For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are as angels of God in heaven.

verses.text: For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are as angels of God in heaven.

sinaiticus.text: But, concerning the resurrection of the dead, have you not read that which was spoken to you by God, saying:

verses.text: But, concerning the resurrection of the dead, have you not read that which was spoken to you by God, saying:

sinaiticus.text: I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob? He is not the God of the dead, but of the living.

verses.text: I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob? He is not the God of the dead, but of the living.

sinaiticus.text: And the multitudes hearing it were astonished at his teaching.

verses.text: And the multitudes hearing it were astonished at his teaching.

sinaiticus.text: But the Pharisees, hearing that he had put the Sadducees to silence, came together to the same place;

verses.text: But the Pharisees, hearing that he had put the Sadducees to silence, came together to the same place;

sinaiticus.text: and one of them, a lawyer, asked a question, tempting him:

verses.text: and one of them, a lawyer, asked a question, tempting him:

sinaiticus.text: Teacher, what commandment is great in the law?

verses.text: Teacher, what commandment is great in the law?

sinaiticus.text: And he said to him: Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with thy whole heart, and with thy whole soul, and with thy whole mind.

verses.text: And he said to him: Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with thy whole heart, and with thy whole soul, and with thy whole mind.

sinaiticus.text: This is the great and first commandment.

verses.text: This is the great and first commandment.

sinaiticus.text: A second is like it: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.

verses.text: A second is like it: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.

sinaiticus.text: On these two commandments hang the whole law and the prophets.

verses.text: On these two commandments hang the whole law and the prophets.

sinaiticus.text: But as the Pharisees had come together, Jesus asked them a question,

verses.text: But as the Pharisees had come together, Jesus asked them a question,

sinaiticus.text: saying: What think you of the Christ? Whose son is he? They say to him: David’s.

verses.text: saying: What think you of the Christ? Whose son is he? They say to him: David’s.

sinaiticus.text: He says to them: How then does David in spirit call him Lord, saying:

verses.text: He says to them: How then does David in spirit call him Lord, saying:

sinaiticus.text: The Lord said to my Lord: Sit at my right hand till I put thy enemies under thy feet.54

verses.text: The Lord said to my Lord: Sit at my right hand till I put thy enemies under thy feet.54

sinaiticus.text: If thus David calls him, Lord, how is he his son?

verses.text: If thus David calls him, Lord, how is he his son?

sinaiticus.text: And no one was able to answer him a word, nor did any one from that day venture to ask him another question.

verses.text: And no one was able to answer him a word, nor did any one from that day venture to ask him another question.

sinaiticus.text: Then Jesus spoke to the multitudes and to his disciples,

verses.text: Then Jesus spoke to the multitudes and to his disciples,

sinaiticus.text: saying: The scribes and Pharisees have sat down in Moses’ seat.

verses.text: saying: The scribes and Pharisees have sat down in Moses’ seat.

sinaiticus.text: All things therefore whatever they bid you, do and observe; but do not according to their works; for they say and do not.

verses.text: All things therefore whatever they bid you, do and observe; but do not according to their works; for they say and do not.

sinaiticus.text: And they bind heavy burdens and lay them on the shoulders of men; but themselves will not move them with one of their fingers.

verses.text: And they bind heavy burdens and lay them on the shoulders of men; but themselves will not move them with one of their fingers.

sinaiticus.text: And all their works they do to be seen by men; for they make broad their phylacteries, and enlarge their fringes;

verses.text: And all their works they do to be seen by men; for they make broad their phylacteries, and enlarge their fringes;

sinaiticus.text: and they love the first reclining places at suppers and the first seats in the synagogues,

verses.text: and they love the first reclining places at suppers and the first seats in the synagogues,

sinaiticus.text: and the salutations in the markets, and to be called by men Rabbi.

verses.text: and the salutations in the markets, and to be called by men Rabbi.

sinaiticus.text: But be you not called Rabbi; for one is your teacher, and you all are, brethren.

verses.text: But be you not called Rabbi; for one is your teacher, and you all are, brethren.

sinaiticus.text: And call no one on earth your father; for one is your Father, the heavenly.

verses.text: And call no one on earth your father; for one is your Father, the heavenly.

sinaiticus.text: Neither be called leaders; for one is your leader, the Christ.

verses.text: Neither be called leaders; for one is your leader, the Christ.

sinaiticus.text: And the greatest of you shall be your minister.

verses.text: And the greatest of you shall be your minister.

sinaiticus.text: For whoever shall exalt himself shall be humbled; and who ever shall humble himself shall be exalted.

verses.text: For whoever shall exalt himself shall be humbled; and who ever shall humble himself shall be exalted.

sinaiticus.text: But alas for you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; for you eat up the houses of widows, and for a pretext make long prayers. For this reason you shall receive the greater condemnation.

verses.text: But alas for you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; for you eat up the houses of widows, and for a pretext make long prayers. For this reason you shall receive the greater condemnation.

sinaiticus.text: But alas for you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; for you shut up the kingdom of the heavens before men; for you go not in, neither do you permit those who are entering, to go in.

verses.text: But alas for you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; for you shut up the kingdom of the heavens before men; for you go not in, neither do you permit those who are entering, to go in.

sinaiticus.text: Alas for you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; for you compass sea and land to make one proselyte; and when he is made, you make him twofold more a child of hell than yourselves.

verses.text: Alas for you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; for you compass sea and land to make one proselyte; and when he is made, you make him twofold more a child of hell than yourselves.

sinaiticus.text: Alas for you, blind guides, who say: Whoever shall swear by the temple, it is nothing; but whoever shall swear by the gold of the temple, is a debtor.

verses.text: Alas for you, blind guides, who say: Whoever shall swear by the temple, it is nothing; but whoever shall swear by the gold of the temple, is a debtor.

sinaiticus.text: Fools and blind; for which is greater, the gold or the temple that sanctifies the gold?

verses.text: Fools and blind; for which is greater, the gold or the temple that sanctifies the gold?

sinaiticus.text: And, Whoever shall swear by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever shall swear by the gift that is on it, is a debtor.

verses.text: And, Whoever shall swear by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever shall swear by the gift that is on it, is a debtor.

sinaiticus.text: Blind! for which is greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifies the

verses.text: Blind! for which is greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifies the

sinaiticus.text: Therefore, he that swears by the altar swears by it, and by all that is on it;

verses.text: Therefore, he that swears by the altar swears by it, and by all that is on it;

sinaiticus.text: and he that swears by the temple swears by it, and by him that dwells in it;

verses.text: and he that swears by the temple swears by it, and by him that dwells in it;

sinaiticus.text: and he that swears by heaven swears by the throne of God, and by him that sits upon it.

verses.text: and he that swears by heaven swears by the throne of God, and by him that sits upon it.

sinaiticus.text: Alas for you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; for you pay tithes of mint and dill and cummin, and have neglected the weightier matters of the law, the justice, and the mercy, and the faithfulness: these ought you to have done, and those you ought not to have left undone.

verses.text: Alas for you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; for you pay tithes of mint and dill and cummin, and have neglected the weightier matters of the law, the justice, and the mercy, and the faithfulness: these ought you to have done, and those you ought not to have left undone.

sinaiticus.text: Blind guides, who strain out the gnat, but swallow the camel.

verses.text: Blind guides, who strain out the gnat, but swallow the camel.

sinaiticus.text: Alas for you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; for you cleanse the outside of the cup and the dish, but within they are full of rapine and incontinence.

verses.text: Alas for you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; for you cleanse the outside of the cup and the dish, but within they are full of rapine and incontinence.

sinaiticus.text: Blind Pharisee, cleanse first the inside of it the cup, that its outside also may become clean.

verses.text: Blind Pharisee, cleanse first the inside of it the cup, that its outside also may become clean.

sinaiticus.text: Alas for you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; for you are like whitened sepulchers, which outwardly indeed appear beautiful, but within are full of the bones of the dead and of all uncleanness.

verses.text: Alas for you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; for you are like whitened sepulchers, which outwardly indeed appear beautiful, but within are full of the bones of the dead and of all uncleanness.

sinaiticus.text: So also you outwardly indeed appear to men to be righteous, but within are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.

verses.text: So also you outwardly indeed appear to men to be righteous, but within are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.

sinaiticus.text: Alas for you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; for you build the tombs of the prophets and adorn the sepulchers of the righteous,

verses.text: Alas for you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; for you build the tombs of the prophets and adorn the sepulchers of the righteous,

sinaiticus.text: and say: If we had been in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.

verses.text: and say: If we had been in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.

sinaiticus.text: So then you testify for yourselves that you are the sons of those who murdered the prophets.

verses.text: So then you testify for yourselves that you are the sons of those who murdered the prophets.

sinaiticus.text: Do you also fill up the measure of your fathers?

verses.text: Do you also fill up the measure of your fathers?

sinaiticus.text: Serpents, brood of vipers, how can you escape the condemnation of hell?

verses.text: Serpents, brood of vipers, how can you escape the condemnation of hell?

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore, behold, I send to you prophets and wise men and scribes: of them you will kill and crucify, and of them you will scourge in your synagogues, and persecute from city to city:

verses.text: Wherefore, behold, I send to you prophets and wise men and scribes: of them you will kill and crucify, and of them you will scourge in your synagogues, and persecute from city to city:

sinaiticus.text: that there may come on you all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of Abel the righteous to the blood of Zachariah son of Barachiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.

verses.text: that there may come on you all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of Abel the righteous to the blood of Zachariah son of Barachiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.

sinaiticus.text: Verily I say to you, all these things shall come on this generation.

verses.text: Verily I say to you, all these things shall come on this generation.

sinaiticus.text: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that killest the prophets, and stonest them that have been sent to thee, how often have I desired to gather thy children, as a hen gathers her young under her wings, and you refused.

verses.text: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that killest the prophets, and stonest them that have been sent to thee, how often have I desired to gather thy children, as a hen gathers her young under her wings, and you refused.

sinaiticus.text: Behold, your house is left to you deserted.56

verses.text: Behold, your house is left to you deserted.56

sinaiticus.text: For I say to you, you shall no more see me henceforth till you say: Blessed is he that comes in the name of the Lord.

verses.text: For I say to you, you shall no more see me henceforth till you say: Blessed is he that comes in the name of the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: And going out Jesus was departing from the temple; and his disciples came to him to point out to him the buildings of the temple.

verses.text: And going out Jesus was departing from the temple; and his disciples came to him to point out to him the buildings of the temple.

sinaiticus.text: And he answered and said to them: See you not all these things? Verily I say to you, there shall not be left here a stone upon a stone that shall not be thrown down.

verses.text: And he answered and said to them: See you not all these things? Verily I say to you, there shall not be left here a stone upon a stone that shall not be thrown down.

sinaiticus.text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives, his disciples came to him privately, saying: Tell us, when shall these things be, and what the sign of thy coming and of the conclusion of the age?

verses.text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives, his disciples came to him privately, saying: Tell us, when shall these things be, and what the sign of thy coming and of the conclusion of the age?

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus answered and said to them: See that no one deceive you.

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them: See that no one deceive you.

sinaiticus.text: For many shall come in my name, saying: I am the Christ, and shall deceive many.

verses.text: For many shall come in my name, saying: I am the Christ, and shall deceive many.

sinaiticus.text: But you shall hear of wars and rumors of wars; see that you be not troubled; for they must be, but not yet is the end.

verses.text: But you shall hear of wars and rumors of wars; see that you be not troubled; for they must be, but not yet is the end.

sinaiticus.text: For nation shall rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom; and there shall be famines and earthquakes in various places.

verses.text: For nation shall rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom; and there shall be famines and earthquakes in various places.

sinaiticus.text: But all these are the beginning of pains.

verses.text: But all these are the beginning of pains.

sinaiticus.text: Then they shall deliver you up to affliction, and shall kill you, and you shall be hated by all nations because of my name.

verses.text: Then they shall deliver you up to affliction, and shall kill you, and you shall be hated by all nations because of my name.

sinaiticus.text: And then shall many be offended, and deliver one another up, and hate one another.

verses.text: And then shall many be offended, and deliver one another up, and hate one another.

sinaiticus.text: And many false prophets shall arise and deceive many.

verses.text: And many false prophets shall arise and deceive many.

sinaiticus.text: And because iniquity shall be multiplied, the love of many shall grow cold.

sinaiticus.text: But he that endures to the end, he shall be saved.

verses.text: But he that endures to the end, he shall be saved.

sinaiticus.text: And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in the whole world for a testimony to all nations, and then shall the end come.

verses.text: And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in the whole world for a testimony to all nations, and then shall the end come.

sinaiticus.text: When therefore you see the abomination* of desolation, that was spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place, let the reader understand, * The Roman eagle causing desolation.

sinaiticus.text: For there shall be great affliction, such as has not been from the beginning of the world till now, nor shall ever be.

sinaiticus.text: And unless those days had been shortened, no flesh should be saved; but because of the elect those days shall be shortened.

sinaiticus.text: Then if any one say to you: Lo, here is the Christ, or there, believe it not.

verses.text: Then if any one say to you: Lo, here is the Christ, or there, believe it not.

verses.text: Behold, I have told you beforehand.

sinaiticus.text: But immediately after the affliction of those days the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from the heavens, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken.

sinaiticus.text: And then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven, and all the tribes of the land shall wail, and shall see the Son of man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.

verses.text: And then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven, and all the tribes of the land shall wail, and shall see the Son of man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.

sinaiticus.text: And he shall send his angels with a great trumpet, and they shall gather his elect from the four winds from the ends of the heavens to the ends of them.

sinaiticus.text: Verily I say to you, this generation shall not pass away till all these things take place.

verses.text: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.

sinaiticus.text: But of that day and hour no one knows, neither the angels of the heavens, nor the Son, but the Father only.

sinaiticus.text: Watch therefore: for you know not in what day your Lord comes.

sinaiticus.text: Who is then is the faithful and wise servant, whom the lord has set over his household servants, to give them their food in season?

sinaiticus.text: And five of them were foolish and five were wise.

verses.text: And five of them were foolish and five were wise.

verses.text: but the wise took oil in the vessels with their own lamps.

sinaiticus.text: But the eleven disciples went into Galilee, to a mountain where Jesus had appointed them;

verses.text: But the eleven disciples went into Galilee, to a mountain where Jesus had appointed them;

sinaiticus.text: and when they saw him they worshipped, but some doubted.

verses.text: and when they saw him they worshipped, but some doubted.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus came and spoke to them, saying : All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.

verses.text: And Jesus came and spoke to them, saying : All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.

sinaiticus.text: Go, make disciples of all nations, baptizing them into the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.

verses.text: Go, make disciples of all nations, baptizing them into the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: teaching them to observe all things whatever I commanded you.

verses.text: teaching them to observe all things whatever I commanded you.
